notes: Lyon tweaked something at morning skate on Wednesday (Nov. 27) and is OUT versus Calgary.
Goodrow sustained an upper-body injury and won't return to Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game versus the Senators.
McMann won't return to Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game versus the Panthers.
Lundell will be a game-time decision versus Toronto on Wednesday (Nov. 27).
Buchnevich has a lower-body injury and will not return to tonight's (Nov. 27) game against the Devils.
Brodin won't play Wednesday (Nov. 27) against Buffalo.
Lauko is OUT for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against the Sabres.
Granlund is expected to miss his 2nd straight game on Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against the Senators.
Hintz is out for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against Chicago.
Matheson is out vs. Columbus on Wednesday (Nov. 27) and is still being evaluated.
L'Heureux left Monday's (Nov. 25) 5-2 loss to New Jersey taking a cross-check to the face from Timo Meier, Wes Crosby of NHL.com reports.
Sillinger is out for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game versus Montreal.
The Ottawa Senators placed D Artem Zub on long-term injured reserve.
Bortuzzo did not finish Tuesday's (Nov. 26) game versus the Canadiens.
Chaffee is out on Wednesday's game against the Capitals and is day-to-day, according to Benjamin Pierce of the Lightning's official site.
Lauzon is considered week-to-week the Predators announced Wednesday, Robby Stanley of NHL.com reports.
Perron did not play in Monday's (Nov. 25) game versus Calgary.
Gadjovich won't play Monday against the Capitals due to an upper-body injury, and he's considered day-to-day, Colby Guy of The Palm Beach Post reports.
Kreider is out for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game in Carolina and is still considered day-to-day.
Kane did not play in Monday's (Nov. 25) game against Islanders.
Carlsson won't return to Monday's (Nov. 25) game against the Kraken after sustaining an upper-body injury, according to Derek Lee of The Hockey News.
Drouin is out on Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against Vegas and is considered week to week.
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Dylan Samberg on injured reserve.
The Nashville Predators placed F Michael McCarron on injured reserve.
Whitecloud did not play in Monday's (Nov. 25) game against Philadelphia.
Khusnutdinov is OUT for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against the Sabres, Michael Russo of The Athletic reports.
Kochetkov is OUT for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game versus New York but is only considered day-to-day.
Domi won't be available for Toronto's upcoming two-game road trip, according to Mark Masters of TSN.
Lundkvist did not play in Monday's (Nov. 25) game against Carolina.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Matthew Knies on injured reserve.
The Utah Hockey Club placed G Connor Ingram on injured reserve.
Paul is expected to miss at least another week, ruling him out for the Lightning's next four games, Erik Erlendsson of LightningInsider.com reports.
Gregor will be a game-time decision on Wednesday (Nov. 27) versus San Jose.
Hutton is out week-to-week with an upper-body injury and has been placed on LTIR.
Miller will take an indefinite leave of absence from the Canucks for personal reasons.
Kampf was moved to long-term injured reserve and will be unavailable until at least Dec. 14 against the Red Wings, David Alter of The Hockey News reports.
Hyman remains 5-8 days away from returning to the lineup, Jason Gregor of Sports 1440 Edmonton reports.

The Washington Capitals placed F Alex Ovechkin on injured reserve. Ovechkin underwent further evaluation with team doctors. It was confirmed that Ovechkin has a fracture to his left fibula and is anticipated to miss 4-6 weeks.
The Anaheim Ducks placed F Brock McGinn on injured reserve.
Chytil will travel with New York on their upcoming road trip but is still considered day-to-day.
Jones is expected to miss approximately four weeks with a right foot injury.
Vaakanainen did not play in Monday's (Nov. 25) game against Seattle.
The Los Angeles Kings placed G Darcy Kuemper on injured reserve.
Greenway underwent a procedure for his mid-body injury, per Heather Engel of NHL.com.
Zuccarello underwent surgery and is expected to miss 3-4 weeks, Sarah McLellan of the Minneapolis Star Tribune reports.
The Los Angeles Kings placed D Caleb Jones on injured reserve.
The Seattle Kraken placed F Jordan Eberle on injured reserve.
Ersson did not play in Monday's (Nov. 25) game against Vegas.
The Boston Bruins placed D Hampus Lindholm on injured reserve.
Arvidsson could be ready to return to the lineup in 5-8 days, according to Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
Samuelsson, as expected, was designated for injured reserve, Lance Lysowski of The Buffalo News reports.
Fabbri had surgery on Friday and is expected to be out for approximately six weeks.
Stanley will travel with the Jets for their upcoming road trip, which begins on Friday (Nov. 22) in Pittsburgh, Mitchell Clinton of the Jets' official site reports.
Drysdale skated in a non-contact jersey during Monday's practice, per Jordan Hall of NBC Sports Philadelphia.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Max Pacioretty on long-term injured reserve.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Mark Stone on injured reserve.
Fowler is expected to be out for 2-4 weeks.
The Washington Capitals placed F Sonny Milano on injured reserve.
Glass is OUT for Wednesday's (Nov. 27) game against Vancouver.
Matthews will remain out on Wednesday (Nov. 27) versus Florida.
Mantha will require surgery on his ACL and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
Forbort was placed on injured reserve, per the NHL media site.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Nathan Bastian on the Long-Term Injured Reserve.
Pelech will begin skating as soon as they've been cleared by doctors, but no timeline has been established.
Broberg participated in a full practice on Tuesday and could return to the lineup as soon as Saturday (Nov. 30) versus the Flyers, Lou Korac of The Hockey News reports.
Reilly will have a procedure on his heart tomorrow. He will be out indefinitely.
Barzal will begin skating as soon as they've been cleared by doctors, but no timeline has been established.
Andersen will undergo a procedure to his knee which will knock him out of action about 8 weeks or so, per TSN and RDS Hockey Insider Pierre LeBrun.
Colton is expected to begin skating soon, per Mile High Hockey.
Lazar was placed on the injured reserve with a knee injury.
Duclair has not resumed skating yet, but Lamoriello said the team hopes he'll begin skating in the near future. Duclair has been out with a lower-body injury since Oct. 19.
Dunn will travel with the Kraken for an upcoming two-game road trip but won't be back in action until late November, Scott Malone of Root Sports reports.
Leddy won't accompany the Blues on their upcoming three-game road trip, Lou Korac of NHL.com reports.
Gudbranson underwent successful shoulder surgery yesterday and is without a timetable to return.
The Utah Hockey Club announced D Sean Durz has undergone successful shoulder surgery and is expected to return in 4-6 months.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jordan Gustafson on injured reserve non-roster list.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He has not appeared in a game since 2022.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jakub Demek on injured reserve non-roster list.
The Nashville Predators placed D Spencer Stastney on injured reserve.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Jordan Dumais on injured reserve.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve.
The Boston Bruins placed D Alec Regula on injured reserve.
Jenner underwent shoulder surgery Wednesday and could return before the end of the season, Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site reports.
Jarnkrok had surgery to repair a sports hernia and is now considered month-to-month.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery to repair a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
Laine is set to travel with the Canadiens on their upcoming three-game road trip, which begins Wednesday (Nov. 27) in Columbus, Eric Engels of Sportsnet reports.
Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee this morning and is out 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list.
Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery and is without a timetable to return.
The Los Angeles Kings placed D Drew Doughty on the long-term injured reserve.
Kaliyev will be out of action for 6-8 weeks, per general manager Rob Blake.
The Vancouver Canucks placed G Thatcher Demko on the injured reserve non-roster list.
Marino underwent successful surgery and is expected to return in 3-4 months.
Couture has not resumed skating and remains without a timeline to return, Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now reported Friday.
Vlasic could be ready to make his season debut soon, according to Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury that's expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Evander Kane on long-term injured reserve.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve.
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Jesper Fast on long-term injured reserve.
Brossoit will remain out indefinitely, coach Luke Richardson said Saturday.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Igor Chernyshov on injured reserve.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Head coach Jared Bednar said that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, Adrian Hernandez of SBNation.com reports.
